p: While these counter-hegemonic knowledges and ways of knowing (saberes) have received attention in discussions on critical pedagogy and popular urbanism,(20) relatively little attention has been given to the pedagogic practices (haceres) that nurture and sustain them. Thus, this paper centres on how learning activates collective agency for a socially just habitat, aiming to elicit pedagogic practices that stimulate alternative ways of seeing, listening, being and seeking change.
